Package nzilbb.ag.util

Class Normalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nzilbb.util.CommandLineProgram
      • nzilbb.ag.cli.Transform
        • nzilbb.ag.util.Normalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<Graph,​Graph>, UnaryOperator<Graph>, GraphTransformer
    @ProgramDescription("Normalizes JSON-encoded annotation graphs from stdin")
public class Normalizer
extends Transform
implements GraphTransformer
    Ensures the structure of the graph is normalized.

    In a normalized graph:

    • contiguous speaker turns by the same speaker are joined into one turn
    • ordinal values are set so that they run from 1-n where n is the number of children in a given parent, for words
    • words do not share anchors with turns nor utterances
    • turn and utterance labels are the participant names
    • optionally, if the graph has a single un-named speaker, then the speaker renamed to be the same as the episode name
    • ensures that utterances within a turn are chained together
    • ensure that words don't overflow their utterance
    • ensure words aren't linked to subsequent words in a different utterance
    For this transformer to work, the Schema of the graph must have its Schema.turnLayerId, Schema.utteranceLayerId, Schema.wordLayerId, and Schema.episodeLayerId set.
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

      • getMinimumTurnPauseLength

        public Double getMinimumTurnPauseLength()
        Getter for minimumTurnPauseLength: Minimum amount of time between two turns by the same speaker, with no intervening speaker, for which the inter-turn pause counts as a turn change boundary. If the pause is shorter than this, the turns are merged into one.
        Returns:
        Minimum amount of time between two turns by the same speaker, with no intervening speaker, for which the inter-turn pause counts as a turn change boundary. If the pause is shorter than this, the turns are merged into one.

      • setMinimumTurnPauseLength
